resources.string: One easy step for better app privacy

In 2021, we found that 70% of popular apps allow other companies to track your personal information, even when you‚Äôre sleeping.\n\nSee which of your apps do this and take back control with Device Shield.
Device Shield prevents most companies from collecting your data through apps they don‚Äôt own.\n\nWorking in the background, it helps protect you night and day.
Device Shield is free, and you can enjoy all your apps as you normally would.\n\nYou‚Äôll be asked to set up a VPN connection, but Device Shield never sends data off your device to DuckDuckGo.

Device Shield uses a virtual private network (VPN) permission to block many hidden trackers in other apps you‚Äôve installed.\n\nUnlike a regular VPN, Device Shield doesn‚Äôt send any personal information from your device to DuckDuckGo.
Enable Device Shield for a summary
Success! üéâ You\‚Äôve enabled Device Shield. Manage this feature in Settings.

resources.string: Try new features we‚Äôre working on
For a limited time, you can try new features before we release them. Beta features are experimental and may affect device performance.
View a summary of trackers blocked
Block trackers in apps on your device
Device Shield doesn‚Äôt block trackers when apps require them to work properly. Consider limiting use of the following apps or viewing their content in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser instead.

Let‚Äôs take the prime example ‚Äî Google. If you ask most people what Google‚Äôs business is they will say ‚Äúsearch,‚Äù but Google actually makes a lot of its money from serving ads on other sites.

Put simply, Google isn‚Äôt a search company, they‚Äôre an advertising company.

Princeton‚Äôs WebTAP privacy project recently found that Google‚Äôs trackers are installed on 75% of the top million Internet websites. (The next closest is Facebook at 25%!)

Google sells ads not only on their search engine, but also on over 2.2 million other websites and over 1 million apps. Every time you visit one of these sites or apps, Google is storing that information and using it to target ads at you.

That‚Äôs why you may have seen ads tracking you across the net!

DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser blocks many trackers from Google and other companies as you browse. With Device Shield, we can block trackers in other apps, too. This reduces what companies know about you overall, so you can enjoy peace of mind!
Device Shield Activity shows a real-time summary of which apps allow other companies to track you.
Manage Device Shield and view excluded apps in Settings.
What trackers does Device Shield block?

Device Shield blocks known trackers that it identifies from third-party companies, or those different from the company that owns each app. For example, if Facebook owns the app, Device Shield doesn‚Äôt block its trackers, but would block trackers from Google or Amazon. We‚Äôre always on the lookout for other trackers for Device Shield to block.\n\nSome apps and known trackers might be excluded automatically based on whether they‚Äôd work properly with Device Shield enabled.
Why does Device Shield use a VPN connection?

You‚Äôll be asked to set up a virtual private network (VPN) connection, but you don\'t need to install a VPN app for Device Shield to work.\n\nThis permission, which works only on your device, allows Device Shield to monitor network traffic so that it can block known trackers.
How is Device Shield different from a VPN?

A traditional VPN sends your data from the device to its own server, where it secures and anonymizes your data from prying eyes. However, this allows the VPN company to see your network traffic.

Device Shield is different. Instead of sending your data to a VPN server, Device Shield works only on your device, sitting between your apps and the servers they talk to.

Whenever Device Shield recognizes a known tracker, it blocks the tracker from sending personal information (such as your IP address, activity, and device details) off your device. All other traffic reaches its destination, so your apps work normally.
Device Shield works only on your device and doesn‚Äôt send your data off your device to DuckDuckGo. We don‚Äôt collect or store any data from your apps.
